alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:20PM MST until July 31 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 1130 PM MST. * At 819 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Navajo County This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 260 and 261. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Fern Feather Wash, Humpy Wash, Manila Wash and Cottonwood Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
